New Records: Jason Holder became the fourth bowler in men's T20Is to take four wickets in four balls
Jason Holder took a hat-trick in the 19th over, the first T20I hat-trick for West Indies
Key Match Events: Jason Holder took four wickets in four balls, including a hat-trick, to seal the win for West Indies
Sam Billings scored 41 off 28 balls, but England couldn't chase down the target
Akeal Hosein took four wickets for 30 runs
Chris Jordan, Adil Rashid, Saqib Mahmood, and Sam Billings were all dismissed by Jason Holder
Pre-Game Insights: There were no specific pre-game insights mentioned in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Jason Holder said he was proud of his discipline and pleased with how he came back to bowl after a poor start
West Indies captain Kieron Pollard said the team had worked tirelessly and rallied together to win the match
Moeen Ali said England didn't adapt well to the conditions and that the new ball came on nicely, but got harder as it got older
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the sixiest bilateral T20I series of all time
Jason Holder was named the Player of the Series
The match was played at Kensington Oval, Bridgetown, Barbados
